description:
2011.3~d2~20110613.1176-0ubuntu0ppa1~natty1

[TRACE]
2011-06-14 03:32:36,765 ERROR nova.scheduler.manager [-] Driver Method schedule_run_instance missing: 'ZoneManager' object has no attribute 'select'
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/manager.py", line 90, in _schedule
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     **kwargs)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/zone_aware_scheduler.py", line 181, in schedule_run_instance
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     build_plan = self.select(context, request_spec)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/zone_aware_scheduler.py", line 200, in select
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     *args, **kwargs)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/zone_aware_scheduler.py", line 236, in _schedule
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     specs=json_spec)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/zone_aware_scheduler.py", line 53, in _call_zone_method
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     return api.call_zone_method(context, method, specs=specs)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/api.py", line 134, in call_zone_method
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:     zone_method = getattr(nova.zones, method)
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE: AttributeError: 'ZoneManager' object has no attribute 'select'
(nova.scheduler.manager): TRACE:
2011-06-14 03:32:36,766 ERROR nova [-] Exception during message handling
(nova): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/rpc.py", line 232, in _process_data
(nova): TRACE:     rval = node_func(context=ctxt, **node_args)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/manager.py", line 94, in _schedule
(nova): TRACE:     host = self.driver.schedule(elevated, topic, *args, **kwargs)
(nova): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/nova/scheduler/zone_aware_scheduler.py", line 209, in schedule
(nova): TRACE:     raise driver.NoValidHost(_('No hosts were available'))
(nova): TRACE: NoValidHost: No hosts were available
(nova): TRACE:


==nova.conf==
##Scheduleri##
--allow_admin_api=true
--enable_zone_routing=true
--zone_name=zone1
--scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.host_filter.HostFilterScheduler
--default_host_filter=nova.scheduler.host_filter.AllHostsFilter
--build_plan_encryption_key=c286696d887c9aa0611bbb3e2025a45b

==zone-info==
+------------+---------------+
|  Property  |     Value     |
+------------+---------------+
| hypervisor | xenserver;kvm |
| name       | zone1         |
| os         | linux;windows |


==zone-list==
+----+-------+-----------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------+
| ID |  Name | Is Active |                Capabilities                |            API URL             |
+----+-------+-----------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------+
| 1  | zone1 | True      | hypervisor=xenserver;kvm, os=linux;windows | http://172.16.4.176:8774/v1.0/ |
+----+-------+-----------+--------------------------------------------+--------------------------------+
title: Distributed Scheduler failed to run up instance

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tonytkdk

comments.content:
Sounds like you're got an old version of python-novaclient in the child zone. 

Check that you've got v2.5+ running in all Zones.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content:
Thanks Sandy W.

Yes , due to my installation from ppa repository on nova trunk.

The python-novaclient library is 2.4.2.

A foolish question , 
I already got the 2.5+ branch from bzr

But I don't know how to upgrade an exist 2.4.2 python-novaclient to 2.5+.

Any hint, actually I tried #python setup.py install 
But nova cmd seems still using 2.4.2 library.

Thanks for ur help
Cheers 
Hugo Kuo
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~tonytkdk
